title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.18 - Empire state challenger graduate fellowships for teachers

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.18 - Empire state challenger graduate fellowships for teachers

State Regulations
(a) As used in this section, an award field
shall mean mathematics, science and such other fields identified by the
commissioner as having a shortage of teachers. (b) Eligibility. A candidate shall be
eligible to compete for such fellowships under the provisions of subdivision 8
of section
605
of the

Education Law if such candidate shall begin or continue study in a registered
program of graduate study leading to certification as a teacher in an award
field during the academic year immediately following the academic year in which
the competition is held. Award winners shall be selected on the basis of such
factors as: (1)
academic
performance; (2)
the number of
teaching vacancies in the award fields; and
(3)
the representation of minority groups
within each award field. (c) Repayment pursuant to the terms of
subdivision 8 of section
605
of the

Education Law shall not be required, provided that the recipient of an award
shall commence teaching within 16 months of completion of study leading to
permanent certification as a teacher in the field for which the fellowship was
awarded, and the service obligation shall be completed within 40 months. Such
service shall include the teaching of at least three periods a day or its
equivalent in the award field as verified by the chief school
officer. (d) Should an award
recipient at any point before completion of the teaching program withdraw from
an approved program or cancel the agreement to teach, or should the award be
revoked for other cause, the recipient shall not thereafter be eligible for
further awards under the provisions of subdivision 8 of section
605
of the

Education Law, and the full amount of the awards already received shall be
subject to repayment. Such repayment shall begin not later than one year
following the completion of full-time study or part-time study, according to
the type of award. (e) Notwithstanding the provisions of section
145-2.1
(a)(1)
of
this Part, for purposes of awarding the Empire State Challenger fellowships, part-time study means enrollment for at least six semester hours during the
academic year for which an award is received. Notes
